title: The Jazz Singer
brief_description: The Jazz Singer is a 1927 American musical drama film directed by Alan Crosland. It is the first feature-length motion picture with not only a synchronised recorded music score but also lip-synchronous singing and speech in several isolated sequences.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

description: A young Jewish man is torn between tradition and individuality when his old-fashioned family objects to his career as a jazz singer. This is the first full length feature film to use synchronised sound, and is the original film musical.
